2 expected benefit has been marked as answer: financial and non financial benefits.

I believe A & D are best ones.
A shows the option and assessment.
While C statement includes the option of outsourcing services, but it is mainly talking about how to do it instead of what it is. Also, using external consultants is something already decided and implemented, it is not an option anymore.

questions.question_text: Which 2 statements should be recorded under the Expected benefits heading?

choices.B: Outsourcing would allow MFH to take advantage of the best services the outsourcing industry has to offer.
choices.A: The 10-year outsourcing contract, at current prices, will be worth ֲ£80m.
choices.E: The confirmed cost of the Outsourcing project is ֲ£2.5m, but with considerable savings over 10 years.
choices.C: The total expected savings over 10 years, at current prices, is ֲ£20m.
choices.D: The 10-year outsourcing contract will enable MFH to stabilize costs at agreed levels.

choices.C: The project will take two years to deliver.
choices.D: Staff may lose the opportunity to work in Information Technology.
choices.B: Staff morale will be negatively affected.
choices.E: MFH will lose direct control over the outsourced business functions.

discussion.content:
The two statements that should be recorded under the Expected dis-benefits heading are:
B. Staff morale will be negatively affected.
E. MFH will lose direct control over the outsourced business functions.
B & E should be the correct answer.
C is related to tilmescale, not disbenefit. The correct answer should be D & E.
why "C" is dis-benefit if it is planned and agreed by stakeholders?
B and E. A is cost, C is timescale and D is risk.

B and E are expected dis-benefits. 
B says something will happen not may happen. it is a expected dis-benefit.
D is something may happen, it is a Risk.
I expected D&E. Why C? B is a risk, not a dis-benefit.

A is cost and C is timescale. 
Correct answer should be D & E.
if we opt for "The 2 year delivery time" why not for"An investment of £2.5m is required" one is project duration and the other is project budget not a dis-benefit
B and E are the best ones to select, I believe
The answer C is not correct! The 2 year delivery time, is not a dis-benefit but a timescale. B (and E) must be the answer.

questions.question_text: Which 2 statements should be recorded under the Expected dis-benefits heading?

discussion.content: I believe B and E are correct. The end of Stage 4 is not a time scale. The stage 4 may take a couple of weeks, or month. Who knows...

A) The contract with the selected service provider will be agreed during stage 3.

E) The transfer of equipment and staff is estimated to take six weeks.
I think B & E, E because it it telling us the timeline for part of Stage 4. Whereas B is telling us the timeline of the expected benefits.
I think D is incorrect because the expected benefits will not be realised for 10 years "There is an expected saving of 20m over 10 years". Please correct me if wrong
B And D
A and E. B and D are benefits, C is a risk.
Agree, B, D seems more reasonable
Should be B & D

questions.question_text: Which 2 statements should be recorded under the Timescale heading?

choices.D: The expected benefits should start to be realized as soon as the outsourced services become operational at the end of stage 4.
choices.C: If more MFH divisions are added to the scope of the services to be outsourced, the project timescale will be extended and the realization of benefits will be delayed.
choices.E: The transfer of equipment and staff is estimated to take six weeks.
choices.A: The contract with the selected service provider will be agreed during stage 3.
choices.B: The expected benefits will be calculated over 10 years from completion of the project.

choices.E: The management stages recommended by the consultants may not be appropriate, resulting in confusion in planning.
choices.C: MFH's operations may be reduced and the 1a-year contract may not achieve its estimated value of ֲ£80m, which would reduce the service provider's profit.
choices.D: The initial estimates, taken from the feasibility study report, indicate that the project will take two years to complete, which means that the business problems would remain for this period.
choices.A: Due to market conditions a suitable service provider may not be found, possibly leading to premature closure of the project.
choices.B: Owing to employment contract changes staff may resist outsourcing, which would make it difficult to transfer staff to the selected service provider.

questions.question_text: Which 2 statements should be recorded under the Major risks heading?

discussion.content:
I also believe A & B are the best answers.
C is a risk but not for the customer organization
D is not a risk as it'll happen for sure
E sounds more like a concern than a risk

I believe A & B are best answers.
D is not a Risk at all. As it is something that definitely will happen.

A. Due to market conditions a suitable service provider may not be found, possibly leading to premature closure of the project. This is a significant risk that could prevent the project from being implemented as planned.

B. Owing to employment contract changes staff may resist outsourcing, which would make it difficult to transfer staff to the selected service provider. This is another major risk that could hinder the successful implementation of the project.
